metadata.title: CVE-2018-17182 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.18.8. Thevmacache_flush_all function in mm/vmacache.c mishandles sequence numberoverflows. An attacker can trigger a use-after-free (and possibly gainprivileges) via certain thread creation, map, unmap, invalidation, anddereference operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-36-generic - 4.15.0-36.39
linux-image-4.15.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-36.39
